body: The court will only grant emergency injunctions in extremely serious circumstances. The following list gives an idea of what the court considers to be serious.

components.html:
- your house or flat cannot be lived in until the problem is fixed
- your physical or mental health has been seriously affected (or that of someone else you live with) 
- financial compensation would not address the problem 
- you would be able to pay for the repairs if the court later decide that an emergency injunction should not have been granted

You will need to work with a solicitor or specialist adviser if you think that taking court action is the right option for you.

heading: It sounds like the problem may be urgent
lede: If you are being seriously affected by a problem with your housing, you may be able to apply for an emergency court order. This is known as applying for an emergency injunction.
